!GitHub starshttps://github.com/digitalocean/nginxconfig.io/stargazers !GitHub contributorshttps://github.com/digitalocean/nginxconfig.io/graphs/contributors !MIT Licensehttps://github.com/digitalocean/nginxconfig.io/blob/master/LICENSE <br /> !Closed issueshttps://github.com/digitalocean/nginxconfig.io/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed !Closed PRhttps://github.com/digitalocean/nginxconfig.io/pulls?q=is%3Apr+is%3Aclosed !Open issueshttps://github.com/digitalocean/nginxconfig.io/issues !Open PRhttps://github.com/digitalocean/nginxconfig.io/pulls !nginxconfighttps://do.co/nginxconfig <h3 align="center">‚öôÔ∏è NGINX configuration generator on steroids üíâ</h3> <p align="center"> The only tool you'll ever need to configure your NGINX server. <br /> <a href="https://do.co/nginxconfig"><strong>do.co/nginxconfig ¬ª</strong></a> <br /> <br /> <a href="https://github.com/digitalocean/nginxconfig.io/issues/new?template=report-a-bug.md">Report a bug</a> ¬∑ <a href="https://github.com/digitalocean/nginxconfig.io/issues/new?template=request-a-feature.md">Request a feature</a> </p> <br /> ‚ú® NGINX Config NGINX is so much more than just a webserver. You already knew that, probably. We love NGINX, because: Low memory usage High concurrency Asynchronous event-driven architecture Load balancing Reverse proxying FastCGI support with caching PHP Amazing fast handling of static files TLS/SSL with SNI A lot of features with corresponding configuration directives. You can deep dive into the NGINX documentation right now OR you can use this tool to check how NGINX works, observe how your inputs are affecting the output, and generate the best config for your specific use-case in parallel you can also still use the docs. üöÄ Usage https://do.co/nginxconfig Features: HTTPS, HTTP/2, IPv6, certbot, HSTS, security headers, SSL profiles, OCSP resolvers, caching, gzip, brotli, fallback routing, reverse proxy, www/non-www redirect, CDN, PHP TCP/socket, WordPress, Drupal, Magento, Joomla, Node.js support, Python Django server, etc. üë®‚Äçüíª Author Rewrite & Maintenance Matt IPv4 Cowley &lt;me@mattcowley.co.uk&gt; https://mattcowley.co.uk GitHub: @MattIPv4 Original version B√°lint Szekeres &lt;balint@szekeres.me&gt; https://balint.szekeres.me GitHub: @0xB4LINT LinkedIn: @0xB4LINT ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Development 1. Clone the repository 2. Install NPM packages 3. Run the development server with file watchers 4. Open the development site localhost:8080 5. Lint your code eslint & stylelint 6. Build for production to the directory ü§ù Contributing Contributions are what make the open source community such an amazing place to be learn, inspire, and create. Any contributions you make are greatly appreciated. 1. Fork the Project 2. Create your Feature Branch 3. Commit your Changes 4. Push to the Branch 5. Open a Pull Request ‚öíÔ∏è Built With Vue.js - Template handling & app generation Bulma - Base styling, customised by do-bulma Prism - Bash & NGINX syntax highlighting üìö Resources Mozilla SSL Configuration Generator v5 Mozilla SSL Configuration Generator OWASP TLS Cipher String Cheat Sheet Nginx Optimization: understanding sendfile, tcpnodelay and tcpnopush NGINX Tuning For Best Performance Hardening Your HTTP Security Headers h5bp/server-configs-nginx Diffie-Hellman DSA-like parameters hstspreload.org Optimal value for nginx workerconnections ‚≠êÔ∏è Show your support Give a ‚≠êÔ∏è if this project helped you! üìù License Copyright ¬© 2020 DigitalOcean, Inc &lt;contact@digitalocean.com&gt; https://www.digitalocean.com. <br /> This project is licensed under the MIT license.
